channel.title: Second model - A basic sword (Primitive Modeling)
channel.description:
Link to my first model: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,472978.0.html
Vote if you want me to release, I have it RS fitted already!
This is my second model. In my first model it three primitives just scaled and colored. In this model I jumped from lightsabers to swords. This took me a while because I had not known the tools at that moment, but I learned and this is the outcome! If you need more views of the sword I am willing to post them. Just say wireframe or regular ;) I did this entirely from scratch and I never even tried tracing, though it was easy, but I find primitives fairly easy, once you get the tools manipulated. :cool: Whadd'ya say? Am I a natural or what? :D
[IMG]http://i634.photobucket.com/albums/uu63/Pysthonic/swordnorm.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i634.photobucket.com/albums/uu63/Pysthonic/swordwireframe.jpg[/img]

item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

haha thanks, but what you mean? oh at the begining of blade? idk it was a leech this isnt even mine JK
Well what I did I was gonna go for a completely different sword but then I said, why not just try a regular sword, and forgot to change blade. next sword I do won’t be wierd on the blade o.o

item.title: Second model - A basic sword (Primitive Modeling)
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:2, topic:377784”]Excellent progress! Glad to see you working harder with those prims! 8/10
Now it’s time to try manipulating them…[/quote]
Hehe, I find modeling more fun than coding! next time I’m going to try a shield, and post that when it’s finished.

Read full topic
